p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Monitor

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Monitor is the electronic visual display for computers. It is the most important output device of a computer. Without monitor we cannot see what computer is doing or performing inside. Monitor is also sometimes referred as computer monitor or computer display. Computer monitors are of two types: CRT (Cathode Ray Tube) monitor and LCD (Liquid Crystal Display) monitor.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Printer

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Printer is an output device used to print text, images, photos, or anything on a paper. The various types of printers include laser printer, 3D printer, Ink-jet printer, plotter, dot matrix printer, thermal printer, daisy wheel printer, line printer, etc. The printers print the text or objects on a paper either in black and white or colored form.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Computer mouse

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: A computer mouse is an input device used for selecting items, opening, and closing items, copying and deleting the items on the screen by controlling the movement of a cursor or pointer on the computer screen. It is also used for creating new folders and browsing internet.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The mouse turns the movement of the hand (left, right, forward, and backward) into equivalent electronic signals that in turn are used to move the pointer. When you move the mouse with your hand on a surface, a cursor or pointer on the computer screen also moves in the same direction. For example, if we move the mouse towards right side, the cursor on the computer screen also moves towards right side. In the similar way, if we move the mouse towards left side, the cursor on the computer screen also moves towards left side.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Generally, mouse has two buttons: a primary button (left button) and a secondary button (right button). Clicking on the left button opens files whereas right button is used for copying files, deleting files, and creating folders. In between the two buttons, a wheel is present. This wheel is used to scroll down or scroll up on the screen.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Speaker

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The speaker is an output device that converts the electronic signals from the computer into audio signals. The user easily hears these audio signals and understands it. Sometimes headphones are also used for listening songs and music from a computer. The speakers are generally connected to a computer via cables. In some computers like laptops, the speakers are built-in.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Like the human brain, computers also store the information. Memory unit is used for storing digital data for future use. Computer memory stores the information temporarily or permanently.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Computer memory is mainly classified into two types:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Primary memory

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Secondary memory

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Primary memory

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The primary memory is used to hold pieces of program, data, and an instruction on which computer is currently working. It also stores the intermediate and final results of processing. After completing the processing, the obtained results are transmitted to the output device.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The primary memory stores the data only when the power is on. When there is no power the data stored in the primary memory will be lost. The primary memory is also sometimes referred as main memory, temporary memory or volatile memory. This memory works faster than secondary memory. RAM is an example of primary memory. The primary memory of modern computers is made of semiconductor devices.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Secondary memory

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The secondary memory is also called as non-volatile memory or permanent memory. It works slower than the primary memory. However, it stores the data permanently.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Secondary memory stores the data even if the power is turned off. Secondary memory has high storage capacity than the primary memory.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The secondary memory stores operating system, text files, images, songs, videos, etc. The Central Processing Unit (CPU) does not read the information directly from the secondary memory. The information stored in the secondary memory is first transmitted to the primary memory. After that, the CPU reads the data from the primary memory. The secondary memory is much cheaper than the primary memory. Optical disks, magnetic disks, and magnetic tapes are examples of secondary memory.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Keyboard

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The name itself suggests that it is a board consists of arrangement of keys. It is the main input device for most of the computers.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Keyboard is an input device used mainly for entering symbols like letters and numbers into a computer. Input is entered into the computer by pressing buttons or keys.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Generally, it is used for typing text and numbers on ms word, note pad, and other programs. Keyboards are also used for playing games.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: A keyboard consists of several keys on which alphabets, numbers, and some other symbols are printed. To enter any text into the computer we press alphabetic keys whereas to enter numbers into the computer we press numeric keys. Most of the keyboards are generally attached to a computer via USB port. The keys or buttons of the keyboard is made of plastic.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Like the keyboards on a typewriter, computer keyboards have keys for numbers and letters. However, computer keyboards also have special keys.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The function keys are found on the top of a computer keyboard. The function keys of a computer keyboard include F1, F2, F3, F4, F5, F6, F7, F8, F9, F10, F11, F12. They perform different functions depending on where they are used. For example, Microsoft Windows users can use Alt+F4 to close the current program or shutdown the computer. F1 is used as the help key. When the user press F1 button a help screen is opened. Similarly, other function keys are also used for various purposes.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Scanner

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: 'Bitter'; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Scanner is an input device used mainly for capturing the printed documents and uploading it into computer as digital images. These digital images are easily viewed and edited on computer. A scanner can be connected to a computer via USB or SCSI.

resources.string: CPU (Central Processing Unit) The CPU (Central Processing Unit) is considered as the brain of computer. A central processing unit is an electronic circuit that carries out the instructions of a computer program. It performs basic arithmetic, logical, control, and input/output operations. The user or human being writes a program to the computer. Computers do not have intelligence, so they could not perform any operations on their own. Hence, all the instructions to the computer are given by the user to perform specific task. CPU controls operations on all parts of the computer including main memory. CPU is also sometimes referred as central processor, microprocessor, or simply processor. It is the most important part of a computer system. In all modern small computers, the CPU is placed on a single silicon chip. Hence, the size of CPU is reduced. CPU consists of two main components: ALU (Arithmetic Logic Unit) Control unit Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU) Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU) is a digital electronic circuit that performs arithmetic and logical operations. In some computers, the Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU) is divided in two parts: Arithmetic unit (AU) and Logic Unit (LU). The arithmetic unit performs the arithmetic operations and the logic unit performs the logical operations. The various arithmetic operations performed by the Arithmetic Unit (AU) include addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Arithmetic unit performs these arithmetic operations at high speed. The various logical operations performed by the Logic Unit (LU) include NOT, AND, OR, NAND, NOR, XOR, XNOR, etc. The results of the ALU are stored in memory for further use. The results that are stored in the memory are passed to output devices. The control unit controls all the operations of the computer. It tells the Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU), computers memory, input and output devices how to respond to the program instructions. It controls the flow of data between CPU and other devices. The control unit efficiently manages the resources of the computer to reduce power consumption. It also checks the correctness of the sequence of operations. The devices, which requires control unit, include Central Processing Unit (CPU) and Graphics Processing Unit (GPU).
A headset can be an essential tool for communication, particularly when working from home, where you may need to block out surrounding noise just to get work done.

Webcam.\n In 1991, the first webcam was up and running at Cambridge University\'s Computer Science Department, but since then, webcams have crept into homes, businesses, public streets and buildings. Webcams are often used for personal use in the home by parents who want to give distant relatives visual access to their children or want to monitor what goes on in the home while they are at work. People might also use webcams in the home to keep an eye on things while they are out of town or even just to see what their pets do all day. The uses of a webcam are limitless. Businesses often use webcams for video conferencing, and webcam technology is used by numerous other entities to give the public access to a variety of information, from weather and traffic to the feeding habits of the most recently acquired zoo animal. Some schools and day care facilities use a webcam to allow parents to see what their children do at school.
